cell.paragraph: The Assembly Info Property Page allows you to embed information about the project and any legality information into the compiled assembly manifest.
cell.heading: 2Assembly Information
cell.paragraph: The Title property gives the assembly a real title. It expands upon the System Name given to the assembly.

This property expands upon the Title property and gives a more detailed description of what the assembly is used for. This allows other developers and co-workers to identify that they are using the assembly for what it was intended for.
The name of the company who places ownership over the assembly .
If the assembly belongs to a product or family of products then specify the product information here.
The Trademark property allows you to embed any Trademark information into the assembly.
The Copyright property allows you to embed any Copyright information into the assembly.
cell.heading: 2 Versioning
cell.paragraph: The Version property is a compulsory property that defines the version number for the assembly.
cell.warning: Note: The version number must contain four sections delimited by a period (.). Each section can only contain numerical '0' to '9' characters. The four parts of the version number are: Major Revision, Minor Revision, Build, QFE (Quick Fix Engineering).
cell.heading: 2Localization
cell.paragraph: This property allows you to select from a number of cultures that will designate the compiled assembly to a specific localization.
